data.title: Ronald Bausman, Arthur Wagner
data.meta_description: The couple, who are retired, are married at their home in Northern California.
data.text:
Ronald Hills Bausman and Arthur Leland Wagner were married Saturday at their home in Petaluma, Calif. Eric M. Bausman, a son of Mr. Bausman who is a Universal Life minister, officiated.

Mr. Bausman, 65, retired as the senior vice president for visual merchandising and shop development at Macy’s in New York, where he managed the display and design for brands produced by the retailer. He graduated from St. Cloud State University in Minnesota. He is a son of Leda E. Bausman of Edina, Minn., and the late Bruce H. Bausman.

Mr. Wagner, also 65, retired as the manager of visual merchandising at the Macy’s store in Santa Rosa, Calif. He graduated from the University of Arizona. He is a son of the late Alberta J. Wagner, who lived in Phoenix, and the late Samuel G. Wagner, who lived in West Newton, Pa.

Mr. Bausman’s first marriage ended in divorce.
